newsitem.title: USA: Smokeless tobacco advertising rising, FTC says.
newsitem.headline: Smokeless tobacco advertising rising, FTC says.

text.p: Advertising on smokeless tobacco rose in 1994 and 1994, continuing a trend that dates back to 1987, the Federal Trade Commission said Wednesday.
In 1987, promotion and advertising cost $68 million. By 1995, it exceeded $127 million.
The total number of pounds of smokeless tobacco dipped but then rose, leading to an overall increase in 1995, the first yearly increase since 1991. Revenue rose despite fluctuations in sales.
The data was contained in a report the FTC is required to make to Congress ever two years.
Smokeless tobacco includes snuff and chewing tobacco.
